content.question: A. How many moles of electrons are transferred for each mole of <math alttext="O 2" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> that reacts? Justify your answer in terms of the balanced equation and the change in oxidation number of oxygen.

frqParts.text: A. How many moles of electrons are transferred for each mole of <math alttext="O 2" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> that reacts? Justify your answer in terms of the balanced equation and the change in oxidation number of oxygen.
B. Calculate the electrochemical potential of the overall reaction.
C. Calculate the value of <math alttext="delta G naught" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>G</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for the overall reaction.

D. When the concentration of <math alttext="N A D H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NADH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> increases while the concentration of <math alttext="N A D with a positive 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>NAD</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> decreases, will the electrochemical potential increase, decrease, or remain the same? Justify your answer.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
